title: How to Swap Between Drivers in Need for Speed

steps.headline: Open the Safe House menu.
steps.description: If you need to swap drivers, press the Safehouse button on the top right corner of the screen to go to your Safehouse. You can also go to Safehouse by pressing “H” on your keyboard.

steps.headline: Click “Change Driver” from the Safe House menu.
steps.description: This will take you to the Select a Driver page.

steps.headline: Choose a different Driver from the list.
steps.description: Do this by clicking the name and then clicking “Enter NFS World.” This will let you play the game as the new Driver you’ve chosen.

steps.headline: Exit the game.
steps.description:
There are two ways to swap drivers in NFS World. The first is totally restarting the game. To do this, exit the game, and you can do this three ways too:
The first way is to press Esc to bring up the Options menu and then select “Exit Game.”
The second way to exit the game is to press the Alt key together with F4. You will exit the game automatically. The third way to exit the game is by pressing the Windows key on your keyboard to return to the Windows Desktop and then closing NFSW by right-clicking its icon on the taskbar and selecting “Close.”

steps.headline: Launch Need for Speed World.
steps.description: You can launch the game from the Start menu or desktop, if you created a shortcut there during setup.

steps.headline: Log into your account.
steps.description:
Enter your username and password into the fields provided, and click “Sign in.”
After logging in, NFSW will initiate an update. As soon as NFSW has finished downloading and installing all the required updates from the Internet, a dialog box with a “Play” button will appear.

steps.headline: Select a new driver.
steps.description: Click on the “Play” button, and press “Enter” or any other key to display your NFSW profile details. Here you can choose a different Driver from the list by clicking the name, and then clicking “Enter NFS World.” This will let you play the game as the new Driver you’ve chosen.

steps.headline: Press Esc during a race.
steps.description: This will open the game menu.

steps.headline: Access the Driver Profile.
steps.description: Choose “Quit Race” from the menu. You will be taken to the Main Menu. Select “Options” from the menu. Once in the Options menu, click the right arrow at the top till you arrive at the Driver Profile page. Here, the current Driver’s username will be displayed.

steps.headline: Select a new Driver.
steps.description: Click “Load Driver profile,” and on the dialog box that appears, use the Left and Right Arrow keys to scroll the list of Available Driver names till the one you want is highlighted. Click “OK” to swap to that Driver. You will receive a confirmation that the new Driver’s profile has been loaded.

steps.headline: Exit the menu.
steps.description: Click the “Back” button at the bottom of the Driver Profile page to exit back to the Main Menu. You can now race using the new Driver name you selected!

text:
via the Safe House Menu Open the Safe House menu. If you need to swap drivers, press the Safehouse button on the top right corner of the screen to go to your Safehouse. You can also go to Safehouse by pressing “H” on your keyboard. Click “Change Driver” from the Safe House menu. This will take you to the Select a Driver page. Choose a different Driver from the list. Do this by clicking the name and then clicking “Enter NFS World.” This will let you play the game as the new Driver you’ve chosen. Restarting the Game Exit the game. There are two ways to swap drivers in NFS World. The first is totally restarting the game. To do this, exit the game, and you can do this three ways too:
The first way is to press Esc to bring up the Options menu and then select “Exit Game.”
The second way to exit the game is to press the Alt key together with F4. You will exit the game automatically. The third way to exit the game is by pressing the Windows key on your keyboard to return to the Windows Desktop and then closing NFSW by right-clicking its icon on the taskbar and selecting “Close.” Launch Need for Speed World. You can launch the game from the Start menu or desktop, if you created a shortcut there during setup. Log into your account. Enter your username and password into the fields provided, and click “Sign in.”
After logging in, NFSW will initiate an update. As soon as NFSW has finished downloading and installing all the required updates from the Internet, a dialog box with a “Play” button will appear. Select a new driver. Click on the “Play” button, and press “Enter” or any other key to display your NFSW profile details. Here you can choose a different Driver from the list by clicking the name, and then clicking “Enter NFS World.” This will let you play the game as the new Driver you’ve chosen. Need for Speed Hot Pursuit (PC) Press Esc during a race. This will open the game menu. Access the Driver Profile. Choose “Quit Race” from the menu. You will be taken to the Main Menu. Select “Options” from the menu. Once in the Options menu, click the right arrow at the top till you arrive at the Driver Profile page. Here, the current Driver’s username will be displayed. Select a new Driver. Click “Load Driver profile,” and on the dialog box that appears, use the Left and Right Arrow keys to scroll the list of Available Driver names till the one you want is highlighted. Click “OK” to swap to that Driver. You will receive a confirmation that the new Driver’s profile has been loaded. Exit the menu. Click the “Back” button at the bottom of the Driver Profile page to exit back to the Main Menu. You can now race using the new Driver name you selected!
